item.title: This Week in AI: OpenAI is stretched thin
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Hiya, folks, welcome to TechCrunch’s regular AI newsletter. If you want this in your inbox every Wednesday, sign up here. After a brief hiatus, we’re back with a few show notes on OpenAI’s DevDay. The keynote yesterday morning in San Francisco was remarkable for its subdued tone — a contrast to the rah-rah, hypebeast-y address from […]

item.title: OpenAI raises $6.6B and is now valued at $157B
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
ChatGPT maker OpenAI has closed the largest VC round of all time. The startup today announced that it raised $6.6 billion in a funding round that values OpenAI at $157 billion post-money. Led by previous investor Thrive Capital, the new cash brings OpenAI’s total raised to $17.9 billion, per Crunchbase. Thrive invested around $1.3 billion, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: J.B. Hunt and UP.Labs launch venture lab to build logistics startups
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Transportation and freight network giant J.B. Hunt is on the hunt for software and digital products that will fuel its business and help it adapt to the modern world — and even dominate the industry. And it’s tapping startup incubator UP.Labs to help build them.  On Wednesday at the UP Summit event in Bentonville, Arkansas, […]

item.title: Facebook says it paid content creators $2B this year
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Are creators sleeping on Facebook? Though the social network has been more enticing for AI Shrimp Jesus than young people, Facebook is consolidating its monetization programs into a more streamlined Facebook Content Monetization hub, which will reward creators for their Reels, longer videos, photos and text posts. This change could incentivize more creators to work […]

item.title: AI coding startup Poolside raises $500M from eBay, Nvidia and others
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Poolside, the AI-powered software dev platform, has raised half a billion dollars in new capital. The cash came in the form of a Series B led by Bain Capital Ventures, which also had participation from a who’s who of big tech firms including eBay (via eBay Ventures) and Nvidia. It brings Poolside’s total raised to […]

item.title: Waymo begins offering robotaxi rides in Austin to certain members of the public
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Waymo has gotten one step closer to a commercial launch in Austin by early 2025. This week, the company will open its fully autonomous ride-hailing service to certain members of the public in the city as it gears up to partner with Uber next year. The initial riders will have 24/7 access to the service […]

item.title: Instant harkens back to a pre-Google Firebase
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Instant wants to recapture some of the magic of the pre-Google-acquisition Firebase by building a modern, Postgres-based open source version of it.   Like the original Firebase, San Francisco-based Instant focuses on giving front-end developers easy access to a real-time database with offline capabilities without the need to manage any of the back-end architecture. The service […]

item.title: Gmail’s new ‘summary cards’ help you take action on your emails, like tracking packages and checking into flights
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Competition in the email market is heating up. After Apple’s iOS 18 introduced a slew of Gmail-like features to Apple’s Mail app, including categorization of transactions, updates, and promotions, as well as the addition of Smart Replies (in the coming iOS 18.1 update), Google on Wednesday announced a set of enhancements for Gmail, too. Google’s […]

item.title: News agency AFP notifies French authorities of potential data breach
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The Paris-based news giant said it notified French regulators of a potential data breach following a recent cyberattack.

item.title: Pallet uses AI to bring logistics into the 21st century
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Transportation and warehousing are multi-trillion-dollar industries, but the technologies that power them are often outdated, inefficient and siloed. Pallet, which is announcing an $18 million Series A funding round led by Bain Capital Ventures today, has built an all-in-one transportation and warehouse management system that uses AI to help these businesses streamline their operations from […]

item.title: Starling Bank fined $39 million for ‘facilitating financial crime’
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Starling Bank, a popular challenger bank based in the U.K., has received a £29 million fine from the country’s financial regulator (around $39 million at current exchange rates). The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) found the startup didn’t have proper financial crime controls from 2021 to 2023. Starling has been around for more than a decade. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: TechCrunch reimagined: welcome to our new design
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
Sometimes, you have to start from scratch to make something amazing. Sometimes, you already have most of the ingredients, but you have to do some improvising to make the thing sing. Until today, TechCrunch was in the latter camp. Top reporters who know how to get to the bottom of a story? Check. Must-read news […]

item.title: Livesteam shopping app Whatnot adds a rewards program as GMV tops $2B
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Whatnot, the livestream marketplace platform for trading card collectors and sneakerheads alike, is offering a bit of positive news at a time when the overall livestream shopping industry is failing to gain traction in the U.S. The company announced on Wednesday that its annual gross merchandise volume (GMV) in livestream sales surpassed $2 billion this […]

Permanent is building a marketplace that connects commercial buyers with farms that use regenerative growing practices.

item.title: Spill, the Black-owned Twitter alternative, scores investment from Kerry Washington

item.description:
as the second anniversary of Spill rolls around, Spill has something else to celebrate: Emmy-winning actress Kerry Washington has made an investment in his app.

item.title: Why is ChatGPT so bad at math?
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
You might've noticed that ChatGPT — and AI in general — isn't good at math. There's a reason, and it has to do with how modern AI is built.

item.title: The lawmaker behind California’s vetoed AI bill, SB 1047, has harsh words for Silicon Valley
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
The lawmaker behind California’s recently vetoed AI bill, SB 1047, is going down swinging. For months, Silicon Valley debated whether SB 1047 would have a chilling effect on California’s AI boom or would protect against catastrophic harms from advanced AI systems. The answer never became clear, since California governor Gavin Newsom decided it was the […]

item.title: TuSimple founder Xiaodi Hou is back with a new autonomous truck startup
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Two years ago, Xiaodi Hou was ousted from his position as CEO of TuSimple, an autonomous trucking startup he co-founded that has since shut down U.S. operations and delisted from the stock exchange — and, in an odd twist, the company has pivoted to AI animation and gaming in China.  Now Hou is back with […]
